newsitem.title: USA: TVA shuts Browns Ferry 2 Ala. nuclear power plant.
newsitem.headline: TVA shuts Browns Ferry 2 Ala. nuclear power plant.

text.p: TVA Nuclear, a unit of the federal Tennessee Valley Authority, has fully shut power production at its 1,065 megawatt (MW) Browns Ferry 2 nuclear power plant, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) reported Wednesday.
The NRC said unit 2, one of three 1,065 MW units at the Decatur, Ala., facility, shut production after its turbine tripped.
"The turbine trip occurred due to the operation of the generator backup relay," the NRC said, referring to a status report from the operator.
"The cause of the generator backup relay operation is unknown and being investigated," the NRC added.
No estimated restart time was given for the unit, which is is currently in hot shutdown. Hot shutdown indicates the reactor is being kept active.
Browns Ferry unit 3 is producing at full power. Unit 1 has been shut for nearly 12 years.
